alert.note: Alert for Estill; Jackson; Lee; Menifee; Montgomery; Powell; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:51PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Powell, southeastern Montgomery, Estill, north central Jackson, southwestern Menifee, north central Lee and northwestern Wolfe Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 650 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Cressy to Wiseman Crossing Station to West Irvine to Ravenna to Drip Rock. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hardwick, Willow Tree, Kimbrell and Spout Springs around 655 PM EDT. Vaughns Mill, Pitts and Shade around 700 PM EDT. Clay City, Fitchburg, Virden, Cottage Furnace, Westbend, Pryse, Texola, Powell Valley and Waltersville around 705 PM EDT. Stanton, Furnace, Cobhill, Knowlton and Crystal around 710 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Patsey, Rogers Chapel, Camargo, Lombard, Pilot, Cat Creek, Bowen, Rosslyn, See, Bean, Standing Rock, Jeffersonville, Means, Oggs Station, Lucky Stop, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Cornwell, Slade, Haystack, Nada, Rothwell, Natural Bridge S.P., Fagan, Cedar Groves and Clay Lick. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Estill; Jackson; Lee; Menifee; Montgomery; Powell; Wolfe
